ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. Post Content:
International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

Post Content:
International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.

ğŸš€ What Makes a Great Contractor? ğŸš€Itâ€™s great to see the day rate contract market picking up after a slower 18 months! But while demand is on the rise, contract roles remain highly competitive.As recruiters, we can often tell instantly when we come across a standout contractorâ€”those professionals who not only secure roles quickly but also get extended or rebooked time and time again. So, what sets them apart?ğŸ’¡ Hereâ€™s what makes a great contractor stand out from a good one:âœ… Adaptability & Speed â€“ The best contractors can hit the ground running. They quickly grasp new environments, tools, and processes, making an immediate impact rather than needing lengthy onboarding.âœ… Clear, Outcome-Focused Communication â€“ Whether you're a BA running workshops or a QA reporting defects, clear communication is key. Contractors who can articulate problems, solutions, and outcomes concisely make life easier for teams and stakeholders.âœ… Proven Expertise & Specialisation â€“ While generalists have their place, the most in-demand contractors own their niche. Whether itâ€™s API testing, regulatory change, data migration, or system integrations, those with clear specialisation stand out.âœ… A Strong Contracting Mindset â€“ Contracting is different from permanent roles. The best contractors own their deliverables, manage their time well, and require minimal hand-holding. They understand their role is to solve a problem, not just fill a seat.âœ… Proactive Problem-Solving â€“ No one wants a contractor who just highlights issuesâ€”they want someone who brings solutions. Whether itâ€™s identifying process improvements or flagging risks early, the best contractors think ahead.âœ… Contract Extensions & Repeat Hirers â€“ While contracts sometimes get cut short for reasons outside your control, a track record of extensions or repeat work with the same clients speaks volumes. A history of 9-month+ contracts shows that youâ€™re not just a short-term fixâ€”youâ€™re someone companies value and that you value your commitment to them!âœ… An Updated & Targeted CV â€“ Time is everything in contract recruitment. A great contractor has a sharp, up-to-date CV that clearly outlines their latest projects, tech stack, and achievements, making it easy for hiring managers to see their value instantly (generally in 5 pages or less!!)âœ… Strong Professional Networks â€“ Many contracts get filled before they even hit the market. Contractors who stay engaged with their recruiters, industry contacts, and past clients are often first in line for new opportunities.ğŸš€ Levelling Up Your Contracting Game? ğŸš€ If youâ€™re looking to secure your next BA or QA contract, focusing on these areas can make all the difference. And if youâ€™re on the hunt for your next gigâ€”letâ€™s connect!What do you think makes a standout contractor? I know there may be some different opinions out there, would love to hear your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ‘‡hashtag#BusinessAnalysis hashtag#QualityAssurance hashtag#ContractRecruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

Username: Arborway Immigration Inc. Arborway Immigration Inc.
Post Content:
Effective March 25, 2025, IRCC has removed the additional CRS points for arranged employment from the Express Entry system. Previously, candidates could receive 50 or 200 extra points for a valid job offer, significantly boosting their chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence. This change affects all candidates in the Express Entry pool who had these additional points. However, those who have already received ITAs or have applications in progress are not impacted. IRCC has stated that this is a temporary measure but has not specified an end date. hashtag#ArborwayImmigration hashtag#CanadağŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ hashtag#Immigrant hashtag#Immigration hashtag#MigrateToCanada hashtag#StudyInCanada hashtag#WorkInCanada hashtag#ForeignNational hashtag#ExpressEntry hashtag#IRCC hashtag#PermanentResidence hashtag#CanadaImmigration

International Students and the Canadian Immigration SystemLearn about the recent updates related to the International Students in  the Canadian Immigration System by Lawyer Christin Lee who arrived in Canada from South Korea when she was 12 years old. Since then, she became an immigrant, then a Canadian citizen. Having grown up in the immigrant community, she understands the insecurity that many refugee claimants and immigration applicants go through.Ms. Lee attended law school and obtained Juris Doctor at the Faculty of Law, University of Ottawa, where she pursued her studies in English and French. Thereafter, she articled at a prestigious law firm with a focus on immigration, refugee, and real estate law.
